message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CY

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) as it deals with argument retrieval and annotation from heterogeneous document collections. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of crowdsourcing for data collection, which is a common practice in NLP research. 

The paper also involves machine learning methods for sequence labeling, which suggests that it could also belong to the sub-categories of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Machine Learning (cs.LG). 

Furthermore, the paper discusses the use of stance classification, which is a common task in Information Retrieval (cs.IR). 

Finally, the paper's focus on fine-grained analysis and classification of argument units could also make it relevant to the sub-category of Cybernetics (cs.CY), which deals with the study of communication and control in complex systems.
